snippet: The commission recommended turning some industrial shoreline back into oyster beds, hardening the electric and natural gas systems, and improving insurance coverage.
abstract: Commission formed by Gov Andrew M Cuomo to figure out, in the aftermath of Hurricane Sandy, how New York should adapt to worsening storms amid climate change and population growth, produces 175-page report that suggests extensive menu of programs to shore up the state's infrastructure.

byline.original: By MATTHEW L. WALD and DANNY HAKIM

lead_paragraph: The commission recommended turning some industrial shoreline back into oyster beds, hardening the electric and natural gas systems, and improving insurance coverage.

headline.seo: New York State Storm Panel Recommends Major Changes
headline.main: Storm Panel Recommends Major Changes in New York
headline.print_headline: Storm Panel Recommends Major Changes in New York
